items.title: This Trump Play in London Is a Comedy. Unless You’re American
items.text: Mike Bartlett’s “The 47th” presents political turmoil in the United States for laughs. But some find it more like a horror story.

items.title: The $10 Million Bob Dylan Center Opens Up His Songwriting Secrets
items.text: A new space in Tulsa, Okla., celebrates one of the world’s most elusive creators, and gives visitors a close-up look at notebooks and fan mail.

items.title: Priti Patel migration plan 'set for remarkable results' - new study lays bare huge impact

items.title: With Roe Under Threat, Biden Is an Unlikely Abortion Rights Champion
items.text: Over the course of a half-century in national politics, President Biden has evolved from an outright critic of Roe to a seemingly reluctant and largely quiet supporter.

items.title: Ricardo Alarcon, Diplomat and Castro Confidant, Dies at 84
items.text: As Havana’s go-between with the U.S., he negotiated Elián González’s return to Cuba. He was also the country’s U.N. representative on two occasions.

items.title: India Finds Russian Oil an Irresistible Deal, No Matter the Diplomatic Pressure
items.text: A parade of emissaries have urged a harder line on Russia. But India’s political neutrality over the war in Ukraine has expanded into economic opportunism.

items.title: Signs of an Animal Virus Discovered in Man Who Received a Pig’s Heart
items.text: The patient showed no sign of rejecting the genetically modified organ, but suffered numerous complications.

items.title: State abortion restrictions may jeopardize women with high-risk pregnancies, some doctors fear.
items.text: The patient showed no sign of rejecting the genetically modified organ, but suffered numerous complications.

items.title: Abortion Pills Stand to Become the Next Battleground in a Post-Roe America
items.text: Medication abortion allows patients to terminate early pregnancies at home. Some states are moving to limit it, while others are working to expand access.

items.title: Diego Maradona’s ‘Hand of God’ Jersey Sells for $9.3 Million
items.text: The shirt worn by the Argentine soccer star when he scored two fabled goals, one of which he attributed to divine aid, fetched what is believed to be the highest price ever paid for a sports item.
